Posts.Content: May 5, 2012 06:05PM caybarbe wrote: also, there will be no radiation since it is a phyllodes.  just wondering about anesthesia... i can google things all I want, but I would love some real advice.
Posts.Title: surgery monday- just found out I'm pregnant. help? caybarbe LAstar
surgery monday- just found out I'm pregnant. help? caybarbe LAstar

Posts.Content: caybarbe wrote: i have a phyllodes tumor (hopefully benign!) that they are taking out along with a cm of surrounding breast tissue monday.  i stopped my depo shot when I found out about the tumor less then two months ago was the lasttime i was scheduled for my shot...  we have been using condoms so this is completely unplanned! does anyone know the risks of a lumpectomy when pregnant?  I can't contact my physicians either, since it is the weekend.  Will they need to reschedule?  If the phyllodes tumor isn'tbenign will it harm the baby?  I hope someone out there has some advice, because I am just lost right now.  its enough to just be dealing with the tumor!  for the record, I am 22 and recently married, but was not planning on having children for quite some time.   Dx 3/10/2012, 3cm, 0/0 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: surgery monday- just found out I'm pregnant. help? caybarbe LAstar

Posts.Content: May 5, 2012 06:20PM caybarbe wrote: I convcieved 2-3 weeks ago according to BOTH of my clear blue pregnancy tests.  They need to remove the phyllodes and a cm of surrounding breast tissue.  they already did a core biopsy, the results just weren't clear enough.  Thank you for the support!  none of my friends have had to deal with pregnancy or tumors... the uncertainty of it all is by far the worst.
Posts.Title: surgery monday- just found out I'm pregnant. help? caybarbe LAstar

Posts.Content: May 5, 2012 07:48PM caybarbe wrote: Yeah!  Thanks you guys, it helped clear my head.  thankfully my parents were coming to visit tomorrow for the surgery, so I will have even more support.  I guess now all I can do is wait and try and pass the time.  i will post an update on monday to let everyone know how it goes (and for anyone who has a similar happenstance in the future!).  the uncertainty is difficult.
Posts.Title: surgery monday- just found out I'm pregnant. help? caybarbe LAstar

Posts.Content: May 25, 2012 10:26AM caybarbe wrote: Hey Everyone!  Thanks for all the replies and support.  I have honestly been so up and down and feeling sick I haven't logged on to reply.... I did talk to the surgeon and they did local with sedation!  It was great, and the recovery time was minimal of course the pain was pretty bad though!  I found hot baths to be the only helpful thing really.  And very comfy sports bras.  Bad news all around though.  A few days ago I lost the baby, and today I got the results that it is borderline.  This is tough!  I was starting to get so excited, and felt like it happened for a reason.  My emotions are just swinging all over the place.  They are going to take out even more of the breast, and I have the option to follow up with radiation, though my doctor said that it is most commonly used with fully malignant phyllodes tumors.  I'm going to do local again, because it made the recovery super easy.   I would reccomend it for anyone who wants to have a quick recovery time.   Thankfully, all my doctors are fantastic and very supportive.  I really need to do some research now on the whole radiation option... I would love some more imput!  Thanks to every single person who replied, it really helps, I dont know anyone who has gone through this.  I did get a very adorable kitten, and dyed my hair pink.  both of which seem to be helping haha.
Posts.Title: surgery monday- just found out I'm pregnant. help? caybarbe LAstar
